accessibility.text: The conditional test is key to the loop
In Java, a conditional test is an expression that results in a boolean value (either true or false)
As long as some condition is true, you do everything inside the loop block.
The loop block is bounded by a pair of curly braces, so whatever you want to repeat needs to be inside that block.
UC3M. Programming. Bachelor in Telematics Engineering.
